Package edu.umn.nlpie.mtap.processing

Class ProcessorServerBuilder

java.lang.Object
edu.umn.nlpie.mtap.processing.ProcessorServerBuilder
public class ProcessorServerBuilder
extends java.lang.Object
Builder for processor servers, performs dependency injection of all the various components needed by the processor server.

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors 
    Constructor Description
    ProcessorServerBuilder​(@NotNull EventProcessor eventProcessor, @NotNull ProcessorServerOptions options)  

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    @NotNull ProcessorServer build()
    Builds a processor server that can be used to host the processor on the port specified by ProcessorServerOptions.getPort().
    @NotNull ProcessorServer build​(@NotNull io.grpc.ServerBuilder serverBuilder)
    Builds a processor server that can be used to host the processor using a grpc server builder.

    Creates a new processor server builder.

    Gets the executor service that will be used for background tasks like timing.
    @NotNull Config getConfig()
    Gets the configuration that will be used for the processor server, loading from the location specified in the options, or the default locations if the configuration has not been previously set.
    @NotNull DiscoveryMechanism getDiscoveryMechanism()
    Gets the discovery mechanism to be used by the framework if needed to register the processor or discover the events service.
    @NotNull EventsClient getEventsClient()
    Returns the event client for interacting with the events service, if it has not been set one will be created.

    Gets the command-line processor options passed during creation of this builder.

      options - The runtime options for the server.
      Returns:
      A new processor server builder.

      Returns:
      A configuration object containing the system configuration.

    • getBackgroundExecutor

      @NotNull public @NotNull java.util.concurrent.ExecutorService getBackgroundExecutor()
      Gets the executor service that will be used for background tasks like timing. If one has not been created Executors.newSingleThreadExecutor() will be used.
      Returns:
      An executor service for background tasks.

    • setBackgroundExecutor

    • build

      @NotNull public @NotNull ProcessorServer build()
      Builds a processor server that can be used to host the processor on the port specified by ProcessorServerOptions.getPort().
      Returns:
      Processor server object.

    • build

      @NotNull public @NotNull ProcessorServer build​(@NotNull @NotNull io.grpc.ServerBuilder serverBuilder)
      Builds a processor server that can be used to host the processor using a grpc server builder. The port specified by ProcessorServerOptions.getPort() will not be used and instead the one already configured on the serverBuilder parameter will be used.
      Parameters:
      serverBuilder - The grpc server builder.
      Returns:
      Processor server object.
